referralLink.title: Driving knowledge Test Simulation
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: NSW Government Website for DKT
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

questions.qn: What will happen if you are caught cheating on the knowledge test?
options: You will never be allowed to take another test
Nothing, there is no penalty
You will not be allowed to take another test for 6 weeks

questions.qn: What will happen if you offer a testing officer a bribe to pass your driving test?
options: Action will be taken against you. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.
Only the testing officer will be investigated.
Nothing, there is no penalty

questions.qn: What will happen if a testing officer asks you for a bribe to pass your driving test and you give it to him or her?
options: Action will be taken against all involved. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.
Nothing, there is no penalty.
Only the testing officer will be investigated.

questions.qn: Can a P1 or P2 provisional driver legally instruct a learner driver?
options: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months
Yes, provided L and P1 or P2 plates are displayed
No

questions.qn: To progress to a P2 provisional licence, a P1 provisional driver must hold a P1 licence for a minimum period of -
options: 18 months
12 months
10 months

questions.qn: If one or two of your wheels run off the edge of the roadway, you should -
options: Increase your speed and drive back on the road
Slow down quickly by braking hard.
Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.

questions.qn: If there are no lanes marked on the road, you should drive -
options: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Near to the left-hand side of the road.
Along the middle of the road.
Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.
No, if turning left from a lane marked left turn only.
No, if arrows are marked on the roadway.
questions.qn: If you intend to turn left, are you required to give a signal?

options: Do not overtake a vehicle travelling in the same direction.
Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.
Slow down and be prepared to give way to vehicles travelling in the opposite direction.
questions.qn: What is meant by this sign on or near a bridge?

options: Sound your horn to warn other drivers
Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
questions.qn: When reversing, you should -
How close can you park to another vehicle when parked parallel to the kerb?
options: You must leave at least 3 metres front and back.
You must leave at least 2 metres from the front only.
You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.

questions.qn: Where there is parallel kerbside parking, are you allowed to double-park alongside a parked vehicle?
options: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes
Yes, in daylight hours
No, not at any time.

questions.qn: Do you have any responsibilities when opening a vehicle door on a roadway?
options: No, any following traffic must stop if the door interferes with its progress
Yes, you must not open a door if you are likely to cause danger to road users or impede traffic.
No, there is no regulation to cover this situation.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
options: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes.
No, not at any time.
Yes, in daylight hours.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
options: Yes, provided no taxis are using the area.
No, not at any time.
Yes, if you are carrying two or more passengers.

questions.qn: When driving at sunset or dawn on a dark day, what should you do?
options: Turn on your lights on low beam.
Keep your sunglasses on to cut down headlight glare.
Turn on your hazard warning lights

questions.qn: You are driving at night with your headlights on high beam. When should you dip your headlights?
options: When within 200 metres of an oncoming vehicle only.
When within 200 metres of the vehicle ahead or an oncoming one.
Never, you are allowed to drive with your lights on high beam at all times.

questions.qn: You are driving in a 60 km/h zone, with only one lane for traffic in your direction. You see a bus ahead (with this sign displayed on the rear) signalling its intention to pull out from a bus stop, you should -
options: Continue at your normal speed as the bus does not have priority.
Sound your horn to stop the bus from pulling out.
Slow down, and give way to the bus as it has priority.

questions.qn: Is it an offence to obstruct clear vision of your number plates?
options: No, you are allowed to cover your number plates if you want to.
Yes, at any time.
Yes, but it is legal for a towbar or bicycle rack to cover the rear number plate.

questions.qn: Before driving on a freeway, which of the following should you do?
options: Take something to calm your nerves before driving.
Make sure your vehicle has enough fuel, oil, water and the correct tyre pressure.
Take your street directory in case you get lost.

questions.qn: What must you do if you miss your exit on a freeway?
options: Continue until you reach the next appropriate exit.
Stop, and reverse back along the freeway to the exit you missed
Stop immediately and turn around.

questions.qn: As you leave a freeway, which of the following should you check?
options: Fuel gauge.
Your speed.
Windscreen wipers.

questions.qn: When can a private car travel in a lane marked by this sign?
options: When carrying at least two passengers.
Only within 100 metres of making a turn.
Only to overtake another vehicle.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to drive a car towing more than one trailer?
options: Yes, provided you have held a licence for two years.
Yes, if the combined length of vehicle and trailers does not exceed 15 metres.
No, not at all.

questions.qn: What must you do when you are towing a caravan to help other vehicles overtake?
options: Keep at least 60 metres behind heavy vehicles or other vehicles towing caravans.
Drive at least 25 km/h below the speed limit.
Stop immediately and let the faster vehicle overtake.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to tow a caravan with a person riding in the caravan?
options: Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.
Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
Have a large meal and a cup of coffee
Have a large meal and a cup of coffee.
Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.
Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
questions.qn: Before driving a long distance at fast speed or carrying a full car load, you should -
If an oncoming vehicle crosses the centre line and is coming straight at you and you cannot stop, you should -
options: Drive onto the wrong side of the road and hope the other vehicle does not do the same.
Slow down and hope that the driver will turn away.
Brake, look for room to the left, sound your horn and flash your lights.
Only need to report the accident to the Police if someone was injured.
Must report the accident to the Police Station nearest to where the accident happened within 24 hours.
Do not need to report the accident to the Police.
questions.qn: If you are involved in an accident where your vehicle needs to be towed away and the Police does not attend the crash scene, you -

options: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.
No details at all until you have contacted your insurance company
Only your name and address details if a Policeman asks for them.
questions.qn: If your vehicle is involved in an accident (regardless of the damage), what details must you give, to the other driver(s), if asked?

options: Report the accident to Police within seven days.
Only call the Police if the accident also resulted in over $500 worth of property damage.
Render every assistance and take immediate steps to have an ambulance notified. Then call the Police.
questions.qn: If a vehicle you are driving is involved in an accident and a person is injured, what must you do after stopping?

options: Trains are fast, heavy and cannot stop quickly.
Pedestrians might be crossing.
Car brakes often fail.
questions.qn: Stop signs or flashing lights at railway crossings should always be obeyed, because -

options: You are towing a caravan.
Traffic is blocking the other side.
A station is nearby.
questions.qn: You should not drive across a railway level crossing when -

options: You are about to stop.
You intend to slow down.
You intend to move to the right, at any time.
questions.qn: You should use your right-hand indicator when

options: Stop and check the traffic behind you on the entrance.
Look for a large enough break in the traffic and adjust your speed so as to fit into the traffic flow.
Sound your horn, turn on your indicator lights and move onto the freeway.
questions.qn: When merging onto the freeway from the entrance, you should-

options: Slow down and watch for traffic controllers and instructions.
Stop immediately and wait for instructions.
Maintain the same speed.
questions.qn: If you see a sign indicating road repairs are going on, you should -

options: Bicycle riders must ride along the yellow line.
You may at any time, park along this part of the road for 1 hour only.
Clearway restrictions apply - you must not stop during the clearway hours.
questions.qn: You see a broken yellow line painted on the roadway adjacent to the kerb. What does it mean?

options: Speed up to pass the horse.
Slow down and give them plenty of room.
Sound your horn to warn the rider.
questions.qn: If you see a horse and rider on the road what should you do?

options: A small bus licence.
A heavy rigid vehicle licence.
A car licence.
questions.qn: A friend lends you a van that has seats for ten passengers. What type of licence do you need to drive this type of vehicle?

options: Once you become aware of the condition you must notify the RTA.
Hand your licence in at the nearest police station.
Tell your doctor and let him or her notify the RTA.
questions.qn: What are you required to do if you develop a serious medical condition that could affect your driving?

options: Borrow the car but only drive on streets where the car will not be a danger to others.
Borrow the car, but always drive it 10 Km/h below the speed limit.
Before you borrow the car check the defect notice to make sure it is legal to drive the car.
questions.qn: A friend lends you his car. It is very noisy and blows a lot of smoke. He tells you the vehicle has been given a defect notice but it's still OK to drive it. What should you do?

options: Go to the RTA and ask them to renew your registration and tell them you will soon get the car fixed
You have seven days to have the car repaired, after which the RTA considers it to be unregistered.
After today you must not drive the car until it has been repaired, passed another inspection and registered.
questions.qn: Your car registration expires today. You have your car inspected for registration renewal but it fails the inspection. What should you do?

options: No, it's illegal to drive a car with a smooth tyre even if it is the spare.
Yes, but you must get the puncture fixed within 24 hours.
Yes, if the tyre is correctly inflated and the side walls of the tyre are in good condition.
questions.qn: You buy a car and find that the spare tyre is smooth; the tread is only just visible. If you get a puncture will it be legal to drive the car with a smooth spare tyre?

options: Ask your friend for a cushion to place behind your back.
Put up with the discomfort; you should not adjust another person's seat.
Adjust the seat forward so it's right for you.
questions.qn: You borrow a friend's car and find that the position of the driver's seat puts you sitting a long way from the steering wheel and controls. What should you do?

options: You can continue to drive at 100 km/h if there are fences to stop farm animals from getting on the road.
Slow down to a speed that will allow you to stop to avoid crashing into farm animals on the road.
For the next 5 kilometres you must not exceed 60 km/h unless you pass an end farm animals speed limit sign.
questions.qn: You hold an unrestricted licence and are driving at 100 km/h in the country and pass this sign. What should you do?

options: Indicating in this situation is optional. Give a right hand signal if you think it will help other road users.
You should not indicate at all because it might confuse other drivers.
Indicate with your right hand signal the same as any other right hand turn.
questions.qn: You are turning right from one of two right turn only lanes. How should you use your indicators?

options: Yes, providing you use the gravel joining roads.
Yes, any time.
No, not at any time.
questions.qn: You are driving on a freeway and realise you forgot something at home. You want to go back for it. Can you do a U-turn on this road?

options: Ask an older person sitting nearby to watch the child.
Take the child with you.
Leave the child in the car.
questions.qn: You have a six year old child with you in your car. You have just parked so you can collect a prescription from the chemist. You should -

options: Put the handbrake on and put the transmission in 'P' (park).
Park only on flat areas.
Turn the wheels away from the kerb.
questions.qn: You want to leave your automatic car parked on a street sloping uphill. You should -

options: Yes, but only in daylight hours.
Yes.
No, not at any time.
questions.qn: You have just passed this sign. Can you park on this road ?

options: At least two metres from the dividing lines.
At least three metres from the dividing lines.
One metre from the dividing lines.
questions.qn: Where there are double dividing lines, you may park -

options: No, only N is correct.
Yes. M, N and O are all legal.
Yes, N is best but M and O are quite legal.
questions.qn: If there are no signs or markings to advise you, can you choose any of these methods of parking?

options: Where there are markings or a sign indicating angle park.
Where the road is very wide.
Where there is plenty of room from the centre line.
questions.qn: You should angle park -

options: Maintain your speed, keeping to the limit.
Sound your horn to warn the other driver.
Slow down and pay extra attention.
questions.qn: This bridge has only just enough room for two vehicles. As you come close to it you should -

options: Mirror B.
Mirror A.
Mirror C.
questions.qn: Which side mirror is adjusted best?

options: The building blocks a good view of the side street.
Intersections cause crashes.
It looks a bit tricky.
questions.qn: You should be particularly careful at this intersection because -

options: Go slower because the slower you go the safer you are.
Overtake the bike quickly and speed up to stop the other driver becoming aggressive
Resist the pressure, stay calm and overtake the cyclist when it is safe.
questions.qn: You are in busy traffic and slow down for a bicycle rider. A driver behind you beeps a horn and pressures you to go around the bike and drive faster. How should you respond?

options: Slow down to the speed of other traffic.
Move into the left lane.
Continue at the same speed.
questions.qn: You hear the siren of an ambulance approaching you from behind. You should -

options: Move to the right and make way for the ambulance.
Turn into a driveway on the right hand side of the road.
Move to the left and make way for the ambulance.
questions.qn: You are driving along this road. You hear an ambulance's siren and see the ambulance in your mirror. You should -

options: Stop and let the fire truck overtake you.
Continue and make the turn because you have the right of way
Speed up to beat the fire truck.
questions.qn: You are about to make a right hand turn at this intersection. You have the green light. You hear a siren and then see that a fire truck will soon overtake you. You should -

options: You only have to obey the signs during working hours.
You only have to obey the signs when there are workers about.
You must obey the signs that are displayed at all times.
questions.qn: When you come across roadworks -

options: Let the emergency vehicle pass and follow it closely behind.
Immediately come to a stop.
Pull over to the left until the emergency vehicle passes.
questions.qn: Generally, if you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle you should -

options: Slow down and stop if necessary to prevent getting in its way.
Keep driving because you have the green light.
Pull over to the left before you reach the intersection
questions.qn: You are approaching a green light in vehicle A. An ambulance sounding its siren is approaching the same intersection and has a red light. You should -

options: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.
Overtake the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Drive carefully at no more than 40 km/h.
questions.qn: When you see these lights flashing on the back of a bus, what should you do?

options: Only on roads that do not have street lights.
On any road, even if there are street lights.
On any road where the speed limit is above 80 km/h.
questions.qn: You are driving at night and there is no other traffic around you. When can you use your headlights on high beam?

options: Leave your headlights on high beam.
Park on the footpath.
Pick a visible position or leave the parking or hazard lights on.
questions.qn: You want to park your vehicle for a short time. It is night time. You should -

options: Speed up and drive over the gravel as quickly as possible.
Check the mirrors and change lanes.
Slow down.
questions.qn: You drive up to a corner where you see some loose gravel on the road. You should -

options: The right lane to avoid slow-moving vehicles.
The left lane unless you are overtaking.
Whichever lane has the least traffic.
questions.qn: When you are driving on a two-lane freeway, which lane should you choose?

options: The right lane is reserved for overtaking.
The right lane is for emergency vehicles only.
The right lane is for avoiding most traffic.
questions.qn: When there are three lanes on a freeway -

options: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.
Drive past the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Be careful, there may be children about.
questions.qn: When you see the headlights flashing on the front of a bus, what should you do?

options: Yes, provided you do not leave the vehicle.
No, never.
Yes, provided you stop for a short time only and turn on your hazard warning lights.
questions.qn: You are driving your vehicle along a street and want to stop for a short time. Are you allowed to double park your vehicle (that is stand it on the road alongside a parked car)?

options: At least 20 metres.
At least 50 metres.
At least 5 metres.
questions.qn: Looking at the diagrams, how far from the approach side of a bus stop or a railway crossing are you allowed to stand or park your vehicle?

options: No.
Yes, but only when you stop at intersections.
Yes, but you must hold the steering wheel with at least one hand.
questions.qn: Are you allowed to use a hand-held mobile phone while driving a car?

options: No, being licensed is enough.
No it is only needed on long trips.
Yes.
questions.qn: Are you required to carry your driver's licence with you every time you drive?

options: They ride too fast and do not turn their lights on.
They are harder to see in traffic and do not have the same protection as many drivers.
They are careless and do not obey road rules.
questions.qn: Bicycle and motorcycle riders have the same rights to use the road as other motor vehicle drivers. They are, however, more at risk in traffic because -

options: Continually scan the road, looking ahead, to the sides, checking side and rear mirrors and anticipate what may happen.
Turn all your attention only to the road ahead.
Ask other occupants in the vehicle to watch out for possible dangers.
questions.qn: To drive safely, you need to concentrate and be able to monitor everything that is happening on the road. To do this, you need to -

options: Slow down and continue through the road works zone.
Stop and then proceed if you think it is safe.
Stop your vehicle and follow the directions of the traffic controller.
questions.qn: If you are driving towards a road works zone and a traffic controller displays a stop sign you must -

options: Stop and wait for directions
Merge to the right and give way to other traffic.
Speed up to get in front of any cars traveling in the right hand lane.
questions.qn: If you are driving through a road work zone in the left hand lane and you see this sign you should -

options: Anywhere inside the windows but only if they are not tinted.
Anywhere including on the dashboard.
On the front and back of the exterior of the vehicle.
questions.qn: Where must L or P plates be displayed on a vehicle -

options: All of the letter L or P.
Only enough of the letter so it is clear whether it is an L or P.
Most of the letter.
questions.qn: When displaying L or P plates, how much of the letter must be clearly visible?-

options: No, they must give way to cars at all times when riding on the road.
No, they must always ride on the footpath.
Yes.
questions.qn: Do bicycle riders have the same rights and responsibilities as drivers and motorcycle riders?

options: Not drive beyond the sign.
Drive with caution.
Not pass another vehicle.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -

options: Drive carefully, roundabout ahead.
Turn left at next street.
Pass to the left of the sign.
questions.qn: This sign means you should -

options: One way traffic ahead.

Right lane traffic may turn right or go straight ahead at the next intersection.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: No turns permitted.
Traffic travels in each direction.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You must give way to traffic on your right

options: You must not turn to the left or the right.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

Zoo 30 km ahead.
Nature reserve 30 km ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Tollway ahead, be prepared to stop and pay toll.
No through road ahead, slow down.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: If there is a footbridge for pedestrians ahead.

options: Road under repair, drive carefully.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Police station ahead.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Children may be crossing the road ahead, slow down and be prepared to make a safe stop.

Pedestrians are not allowed.
questions.qn: You are most likely to find this sign, where -

options: Cemetery ahead.

Crossroads ahead, reduce your speed and watch out for other traffic and pedestrians.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

Slow down and drive carefully over the crossing if you cannot see a train approaching.
Stop until train has passed then proceed immediately.
questions.qn: If the red lights on this sign are flashing what are you required to do?

options: You are approaching an intersection with traffic lights, be prepared to stop.
You are approaching a school or playground.
A give way sign at an intersection is ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.qn: You should expect this sign, if-

options: Slow down and beware of trucks entering from the side.

options: Stop and help aged pedestrians across the road.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Overhead footbridge for pedestrians ahead.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: If a one way street is ahead.

questions.qn: You should expect this sign -

options: Children's playground ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: School children crossing the road ahead, prepare to stop.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Steep down-grade in the road ahead, slow down.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Take a break, rest area ahead.

Drive carefully and watch out for traffic entering from a side-road intersection ahead.

options: Stop at the stop line and give way to all traffic.
Stop at the stop line and give way to all traffic on your right only.

options: You can overtake vehicles only on the left side.

questions.qn: What does this sign means?

Slow down and be ready to stop and give way to a train.
questions.qn: When you see this sign, what must you do?

options: All traffic must turn back at the roundabout.
Slow down, be ready to stop and give way to all vehicles already on the roundabout if there is a danger of a collision.

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Drive carefully, you are reaching the top of the hill and will not be able to see a safe distance in front of you.
Watch out, the road ahead may be flooded.
Slow down, there is a dangerous curve ahead.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -
